articles.title: Ivory, Gift to Kim Jong Il by Togolese President
articles.content:
Ivory, Gift to Kim Jong Il by Togolese President
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Among exhibits at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK is an ivory, presented to leader Kim Jong Il as a gift by the president of the Republic of Togo in October Juche 70 (1981) when he visited Pyongyang.
					 The president prepared the gift out of his gratitude to Kim Jong Il for having rendered all kinds of assistance to the Togolese people in building a new society.
					
					 Ivory is considered to be a symbol of longevity in Togo.
					
					 The gift represents profound reverence of the president and his people for Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Korean Books Donated to Russia
articles.content:
Korean Books Donated to Russia
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of donating Korean books was held at the Amur National University of Cultural Sciences and Education of Russia on April 28.
					 Present there were personages of Komsomolsk－na－Amure City Legislative Assembly and the university, masses and a DPRK vice-consul general in Khabarovsk.
					
					 Works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and book and picture albums introducing Songun Korea were conveyed at the ceremony.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the legislative assembly expressed his will to make positive efforts to boost multifarious cultural exchanges with the DPRK.
					
					 The president of the university said:
					
					 Through my visit to the DPRK I was deeply moved to see the shining reality which was brought about by the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We will set up the center for making multifaceted study of the DPRK, introducing and propagandizing it at the university in the future.
					
					 We will energize exchange and cooperation with major universities in the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian Commemorative Medal Awarded to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighters of DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Commemorative Medal Awarded to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighters of DPRK
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The medal marking the 70th anniversary of the victory in the great Patriotic War of Russia was awarded to anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters of the DPRK.
					 A ceremony of awarding the medal in name of President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin took place at the Russian embassy here on Wednesday.
					
					 The medal and diploma were conveyed to anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters Ri Ul Sol, Kim Chol Man, Hwang Sun Hui, Kim Ok Sun, Pak Kyong Suk, Ri Yong Suk and Ri Jong In.
					
					 A reception was given at the embassy on the same day.

articles.title: Polish Embassy Officials Visit Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies
articles.content:
Polish Embassy Officials Visit Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Polish Ambassador to the DPRK Krzysztof Ciebien and his embassy officials visited Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies Wednesday on the occasion of the Constitution Day, the national day of Poland.
					 They looked round lecture rooms, being briefed on the fact that the university which has developed under the care of the peerlessly great persons is bringing up its students to be talents as required by the new century.
					
					 At the end of the visit, the ambassador wished the students of the university successes in their study.
					
					 They donated books to the university.

articles.title: DPRK Student Places First at Int'l Juvenile Piano Players Concours
articles.content:
DPRK Student Places First at Int'l Juvenile Piano Players Concours
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK student Pak Kon Ui placed first at the 20th Tolyatsi international juvenile piano players concours held in Samara Region, Russia from April 22 to 30.
					 It brought with more than 50 juvenile piano players from the DPRK, Russia, Kazakhstan and Tajikistan.
					
					 In the piano category B Pak Kong Ui won admiration of members of the jury by successfully playing world famous songs with refined, exquisite and dynamic rendition.

articles.title: Symposium on Medical Science of Compatriots at Home and Abroad Held
articles.content:
Symposium on Medical Science of Compatriots at Home and Abroad Held
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The 17th Pyongyang symposium on medial science of compatriots at home and abroad was held at the People's Palace of Culture on May 5 and 6.
					 Among those present there were Kim Hyong Hun, chairman of the Central Committee of the Medical Association of Korea, officials, scientists and teachers in the field of public health, members of a delegation of the Korean Medical Association in Japan headed by Vice-Chairman Kang Kyong Bu and a delegation of Korean medical workers in the U.S. headed by Pak Ki Bom and other overseas Koreans.
					
					 Kim Hyong Hun made an opening speech to be followed by congratulatory speeches.
					
					 The participants heard a lecture titled "On policy of protecting children's health in the DPRK, the best one in the world".
					
					 The symposium heard various papers. 
					
					 Speakers introduced latest research achievements and experience conducive to meeting requirements of the new century and scientifically clarified urgent theoretical and practical issues arising in the development of national medical science and healthcare.

articles.title: Service Personnel and People Pledge to Wind up Project as Scheduled
articles.content:
Service Personnel and People Pledge to Wind up Project as Scheduled
Paekam, May 6 (KCNA) -- Service personnel and people met on Wednesday at the construction site of the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station to renew their pledge to devotedly carry out the order given by Marshal Kim Jong Un. He called for finishing the construction of the power stations No. 1 and No. 2 without fail till the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea by dint of the army-people coordinated operation.
					 Present at the meeting were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol, chairman of the State Planning Commission, army officers and officials of the relevant units taking part in the construction, service personnel, youth shock brigade members and other builders.
					
					 A report was made by Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said the militant order given by Kim Jong Un reflects his deep trust and great expectation that the People's Army and the youth league would wind up the construction project as early as possible through their coordinated operation and give fullest play to the might of the great army-people unity in the drive for hastening the final victory in the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 They underscored the need for the youth brigade members to build all structures without fail at the best level as scheduled and thus fully display their militant might as reliable vanguard of the WPK.
					
					 They called on the service personnel to powerfully demonstrate the might of the invincible revolutionary Paektusan army which carries out whatever task in the spirit of a-match-for-a-hundred and in the spirit of at a go.
					
					 They underlined the need to strikingly demonstrate the might of single-minded unity of the service personnel and people in the DPRK which is developing into the relations of genuine comrade-in-arms and comrades by fully displaying the fine traits of assisting the army and helping the people.
					
					 They renewed the will to complete the construction project till the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK without fail and thus demonstrate before the world the might of the army-people coordinated operation and the might of the power of youth.

articles.title: National Meeting of Officials in Field of Commerce Held
articles.content:
National Meeting of Officials in Field of Commerce Held
Anju, May 6 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of officials in the field of commerce was held in Anju City, South Phyongan Province on Wednesday.
					 Present there were An Jong Su, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and officials in the field of commerce from across the country.
					
					 Kim Kyong Nam, minister of Commerce, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 A reporter and speakers said that the meeting marked a significant occasion in giving strong impetus to the drive for improving the people's living standard by producing varieties of consumer goods through a wide use of materials lying idle and internal reserves. 
					
					 They noted that Marshal Kim Jong Un clearly indicated the way of developing the light industry and has led the work with loving care to ensure that the commercial service to the people made a significant improvement.
					
					 They recalled that positive efforts have been made to strictly adhere to the socialist principle in the field of commercial service and consolidate the foundation of the networks of commercial service in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance.
					
					 They underscored the need to secure more essential goods including primary consumer goods, sundry goods for daily use and building materials, highly aware of being servants of the people.

articles.title: Cosmetics with Long History in Korea
articles.content:
Cosmetics with Long History in Korea
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- From olden times the Korean women have used cosmetics including face powder and lipstick.
					 It is well evidenced by historical relics such as bronze mirror and cosmetic case.
					
					 According to historical data, Korean women used face paint, lipstick, eyebrow pencil and perfume made from natural substances and safflower in the period of Three Kingdoms (3rd century B.C.-7th century A.D.). They also used camellia oil and mixture of beeswax and oil to dress hair.
					
					 In the period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392) there appeared handicraftsmen specialized in the production of cosmetics.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Preserving National Identity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Preserving National Identity
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- To preserve and glorify the national identity at present is an important requirement for hastening the final victory in the drive for building a thriving nation and giving fuller play to the advantages of the nation, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 Protecting the national cultural tradition at present presents itself as a more vital issue due to the moves of the imperialists to dominate the world, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The imperialists are now working hard to obliterate the cultural traditions of other countries and nations while trumpeting about "culture without border" and "world culture". Some countries abandoned their peculiar national identity, taken in by corrupt bourgeois culture and life style, and, in the long run, fell victim to imperialism. These tragic destinies of those countries suggest a lot of things.
					
					 The DPRK is dynamically pushing forward the work to carry forward and develop the beautiful and noble national cultural tradition as required by the times under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The noble intention of the party to further glorify the advantages of the nation is reflected in the folk music, dances, fine art, lunar New Year , January 15th of the lunar calendar and other folk holidays, Ssirum (Korean wrestling), yut-game and other folk games, national dresses and dishes strong in national flavor. 
					
					 Strong is the will of the party to glorify the DPRK as a world famous advanced highly civilized nation with a time-honored history and brilliant culture and a rich and prosperous country true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Ulterior Aim Sought by S. Korean Authorities in Talking about "Nuclear Threat from North"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Ulterior Aim Sought by S. Korean Authorities in Talking about "Nuclear Threat from North"
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- At a recent NPT review conference and a meeting of the UN Disarmament Commission, the south Korean puppet forces pulled up the DPRK over "threat" and "challenge" in a bid to boost "cooperation with foreign forces in pressurizing the north." 
					 The puppet chief executive of south Korea invited to Chongwadae riff-raffs of the U.S. Centre for Strategic and International Studies and jabbered that south Korea is "bolstering up deterrence" to cope with someone's "provocation" and "threat" through "close cooperation" with the U.S., again raising a hue and cry over "nuclear issue of the north." 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The puppet forces' noisy trumpeting about "nuclear threat from the north" is a crafty artifice to justify their reckless military provocation and moves for boosting the cooperation with the U.S. in its scenario for invading the north.
					
					 Needless to say, "the nuclear threat from the north" cited by the puppet forces whenever an opportunity presents itself is nothing but sophism to justify the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.
					
					 They are vociferating about " the north's moves to bolster up the nuclear capacity" and "threat," prompted by their sinister intention to give further momentum to the international campaign for isolating and stifling the DPRK and deter the nuclear hysteria against it from waning.
					
					 No matter what hue and cry they raise over "nuclear threat from the north," they can never cover up their true colors as the arch criminal and warmongers wrecking peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and in other parts of Northeast Asia and increasing the danger of a nuclear war by cooperating with foreign forces.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Scenario for New War against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Scenario for New War against DPRK
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The United States is mulling rounding off the formation of the U.S.-south Korea combined division to perform a special mission for making preemptive strike at nukes and missiles of the DPRK within May, according to foreign press reports.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary terms this a dangerous action as it eloquently proves that the U.S. scenario to ignite a new war on the Korean peninsula has entered into the phase of its implementation.
					
					 The U.S. is preparing two means to eliminate the DPRK's nukes and missiles by force of arms, the commentary says, adding:
					
					 One is ultra-precision weapon like missile and another is task force.
					
					 Preparations are making brisk headway to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK's nukes and missiles with missiles.
					
					 The U.S. is making haste to deploy THAAD in south Korea in a bid to ward off the DPRK's retaliatory strike.
					
					 Arrangements are being stepped up simultaneously to form the U.S.-south Korea combined division.
					
					 Developments go to patently prove that the U.S. is the aggressor and provocateur disturbing peace and stability on the peninsula and in Northeast Asia and bringing the danger of a nuclear war to them. 
					
					 The prevailing situation compels the DPRK to increase all its efforts to beat back the U.S. preemptive attack.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Enact "Law on Human Rights in North"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Enact "Law on Human Rights in North"
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities and the gentries of the "Saenuri Party" held a consultative meeting at the "National Assembly" on April 27 at which they discussed a proposal on coordinating detailed contents of "the bill on human rights in the north" and tabling it as an agenda item requiring quick clearing. This huddle is aimed to railroad the bill through the 19th "National Assembly" come what may.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is an unpardonable act of driving the strained relations between the north and the south into the worst catastrophe. 
					
					 The above-said bill is aimed to escalate the north-south confrontation. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities are vociferating about the "need to enact the law, a product of their sinister intention to realize their ambition for achieving "unification of social systems" under the signboard of "human rights." 
					
					 They are ridiculously trying to enact the law, shelving the reality of south Korea, the land of darkness where the people are in the direst destitution and a tundra of human rights. They are a group of vicious traitors obsessed with confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and the ambition to achieve "unification of social systems." 
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK will not overlook the criminal moves of the puppet forces but mercilessly frustrate them through toughest counteraction. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities have time to go busy with the moves to cook up the above-said law, they had better reflect on having turned south Korea into a colony of the U.S. imperialists and a tundra of human rights and step down without delay.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Demonstrators Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Demonstrators Flayed
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore carried an editorial on May 3.
					 The editorial recalled that the south Korean authorities ruthlessly cracked down on demonstrators in Seoul on May 1 and 2.
					
					 The police laid cordon with buses to block bereaved families and citizens from going to Chongwadae in demand of the abolition of the "government's enforcement ordinance" and encircled them before firing water guns to spray tear liquid, it charged, adding: Many people fell unconscious and were walked off by the police.
					
					 It declared that no crackdown can tone down the voices of the people demanding the probe into truth. 
					
					 It demanded an immediate halt to the action to bring the "proposed enforcement ordinance" up for discussion at the "state council meeting", though belatedly.

articles.title: S. Korean Police's Human Rights Abuses Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Police's Human Rights Abuses Slammed
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, in an editorial on May 4 denounced the puppet police for cracking down on demonstrators demanding the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 Treating bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster and citizens who staged all-night actions on May 1 and 2 as criminals, the police fired water guns to spray tear liquid, the editorial charged.
					
					 On May 1 the police totally blocked the city streets with buses and fired water guns to spray tear liquid, it noted, and continued:
					
					 When bereaved families attempted to march to Chongwadae at dawn of the next day, the police sprayed tear liquid at them and beat them with shields.
					
					 The editorial demanded a thoroughgoing investigation into the police's human rights abuses and punishment of those involved.

articles.title: Brazilian Personages Express Support for Just Cause of Korean People
articles.content:
Brazilian Personages Express Support for Just Cause of Korean People
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- There took place a releasing ceremony of Vol. 3 of Part 1 the Anti-Japanese Revolution of "With the Century", reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung, and an opening ceremony of the Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition at the building of the Goias State Congress of Brazil on April 27.
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos dealing with revolutionary activities of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts showing the wisdom and talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The events were attended by senior officials of the Party for Free Motherland, Communist Party, Socialist Youth Union, Confederation of Women, Goias State Congress and the Goiania City Office and masses of Brazil.
					
					 Staff members of the DPRK embassy were present on invitation.
					
					 The vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil and other speakers mentioned undying feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un and the originality and justice of Songun politics.
					
					 Referring to the impressions of their visit to the DPRK, they spoke highly of the advantages and invincibility of the socialist system of the prosperous DPRK and expressed solidarity with the just cause of the Korean people advancing under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Guinean Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Guinean Media
Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Guinea media praised President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 The paper Horoya on April 14 and 16 devoted one whole page to articles titled "President Kim Il Sung is the greatest man who performed undying feats for the global cause of independence" accompanied with a photo of the President standing together with leader Kim Jong Il and a photo of the President.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Father of people" dealt with feats the President performed by liberating Korea and building the party, the army and the country. It went on:
					
					 The President was, indeed, not only the leader of a country but also the tender-hearted father of the people.
					
					 He regarded it as his duty and worthwhile work to devote himself to the people.
					
					 His image will always be remembered by the world progressives.
					
					 The Guinean Domestic, International and Seven National Languages Broadcasting Services on April 15 aired the whole career of the President characterized by his love for the people.

articles.title: Membros de embajada polaca visitan Universidad de Lenguas Extranjeras de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Miembros de embajada polaca visitan Universidad de Lenguas Extranjeras de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ACNC) -- Con motivo de la Dia de la Constitucion, dia nacional de Polonia, el embajador Krzysztof Ciebien y los miembros de la sede diplomatica de Polonia en Corea visitaron el dia 6 la Universidad de Lenguas Extranjeras de Pyongyang.
					Los huespedes recorrieron varias aulas escuchando las explicaciones de que este plantel docente desarrollado bajo la direccion de los grandes hombres sin pares, forma a muchas personas competentes conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo.
					
					Terminada la visita, el embajador polaco dijo que le alegra de la visita a dicha universidad y deseo a los estudiantes los exitos en su estudio.
					
					Ellos donaron libros a la universidad.

articles.title: Tiene lugar XVII Seminario de Ciencias Medicas de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Tiene lugar XVII Seminario de Ciencias Medicas de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 5 y 6 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el XVII Seminario de Ciencias Medicas de Pyongyang de Compatriotas en el interior y exterior del pais.
					Participaron el presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de Medicos de Corea, Kim Hyong Hun, y los funcionarios, cientificos y profesores de la rama de salud publica, asi como la delegacion de la Asociacion de Medicos Coreanos Residentes en Japon encabezada por el presidente Kang Kyong Bu, la delegacion de medicos coreanos residentes en Estados Unidos presidida por Pak Ki Bom y otros compatriotas en ultramar.
					
					Kim Hyong Hun pronuncio la palabra de apertura y hubo discursos de felicitacion. 
					
					En la ocasion se impartio la leccion intitulada "Sobre la politica de proteccion de salud infantil en nuestro pais, la mejor del mundo".
					
					Y se presentaron algunas disertaciones en que los seminaristas intercambiaron los ultimos exitos de investigacion del nuevo siglo y las experiencias y explicaron profundamente en lo cientifico los problemas teorico-practicos que se presentan en el desarrollo de ciencias medicas de la nacion y en la salud publica.

articles.title: Reunion nacional de funcionarios de rama de comercio
articles.content:
Reunion nacional de funcionarios de rama de comercio
Anju, 6 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 6 en la ciudad de Anju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur la reunion nacional de funcionarios de la rama de comercio.
					En la ocasion participaron el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, An Jong Su, y los funcionarios de la rama de comercio del pais.
					
					Hubo el informe del ministro de Comercio Kim Kyong Nam e intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores subrayaron que la presente reunion sirve de un motivo significado para impulsar con dinamismo la victoria en la gran marcha para la mejora de vida del pueblo al producir por su propia cuenta varios articulos de consumo explorando los materiales ociosos y las reservas internas en la rama de comercio.
					
					Senalaron que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un ilumino el camino a seguir por la industria ligera y condujo a mejorar y fortalecer las actividades de servicio comercial para el pueblo.
					
					Prosiguieron que en el pasado hicieron esfuerzos energicos por mantener estrictamente los principios socialistas en las actividades del servicio comercial y consolidar la base de las redes del servicio comercial con el espiritu revolucionario de apoyarse en sus propias fuerzas.
					
					Dijeron la necesidad de asegurar mucho los articulos de primer consumo, las mercancias miscelaneas de uso diario, las de materiales de construccion y productos de primera necesidad y suministrarlos suficientemente al pueblo.

articles.title: Sistema receptor de satelite para barcos pesqueros
articles.content:
Sistema receptor de satelite para barcos pesqueros
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ACNC) -- La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se esfuerza por la informatizacion y la modernizacion de la industria pesquera.
					Recientemente introdujo el sistema receptor de satelite en los barcos pesqueros de las costas del mar Este y Oeste.
					
					Actualmente, la Empresa Pesquera 8 de Enero del Ejercito Popular de Corea, la Empresa Pesquera 25 de Agosto y otras de Yanghwa, Hanchon y Mundok aplicaron este sistema en los  barcos pesqueros.
					
					El sistema fue desarrollado por el Instituto de Informacion del Medio Ambiente Global de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias.
					
					Uno de los investigadores del sistema, Jong Kum Chol dijo que es indispensable el sistema de coleccion y transmision de datos a traves del satelite para la coleccion de informacion sobre el estado de distribucion del recurso pesquero.
					
					Actualmente muchos paises obtienen en las imagenes fotografiadas por NOAA y otros satelites los datos sobre la temperatura del agua maritimo, la distribucion de plancton y los fenomenos atmosfericos y los utilizan en la pesca.
					
					Nuestro grupo de investigacion introdujo en los barcos pesqueros el sistema de recepcion de satelite tras modernizar la interpretacion y el procesamiento de los datos de satelites.
					
					Los barcos pesqueros reciben automaticamente los datos de satelites por medio del receptor.
					
					Los datos aparecen en la pantalla del ordenador, lo que ayuda a prever la zona de pesca.
					
					Segun Choe Il Gyu, ingeniero-jefe de la Empresa Pesquera de Mundok, introdujo el nuevo sistema en las traineras, asi que capturo gran cantidad de peces ahorrando en un ano mas de 20% de combustible.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia la fabricacion de "ley de DDHH del Norte"
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia la fabricacion de "ley de DDHH del Norte"
Pyongyang, 6 de mayo (ACNC) -- El 27 de abril, las autoridades titeres surcoreanas y el "Partido Saenuri" convocaron una reunion de consulta partido-gobierno en la "Asamblea Nacional".
					En la ocasion discutieron el proyecto de ajustar los detalles de la "ley de derechos humanos del Norte (de Corea)" y definirla como agenda de tratamiento urgente de la 19a "Asamblea Nacional". 
					
					El intento de ellas de aprobar a toda costa esa ley es una locura imperdonable que lleva de mal en peor las relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					La "ley de DDHH del Norte" deviene la infame y conflictiva que fomenta la confrontacion entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					Sin embargo, la camarilla surcoreana aboga por la "necesidad de instituirla" partiendo de su siniestro intento de realizar la ambicion de "unificacion mediante la fusion de regimenes" bajo el pretexto del problema de "derechos humanos".
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos, traidores a la nacion, no hacen referencia alguna a la realidad del Sur de Corea donde la poblacion lleva la vida mas depauperada del mundo y sus derechos humanos se violan de la peor manera.
					
					El ejercito y pueblo de la RPDC castigaran con las contramedidas superintransigentes los actos criminales de los titeres surcoreanos.
					
					En lugar de fabricar la sucia "ley de DDHH del Norte", la camarilla surcoreana debera confesar su crimen de haber convertido el Sur de Corea en la colonia de los imperialistas yanquis y retirarse cuanto antes del "poder".
